column5: In the opening scene,  fish is on rod one 12:00 high, rod 2 fires on the top right, and the dipsy fires off camera two seconds later. - you can see G working this rod in the reflection on the rod holder.   Not one of these fish was less than 8 minutes coming in and a couple were pushing 20.
All i see is "This video contains content from UMG, who has blocked it in your country on copyright grounds."  ?????
you too, huh? Grr. Back to the drawingboard.   Worked for me. Give me another couple hours,,,,, Gotta be Clapton, cause the I know the other one works
Ya same here. You got to play the blues bye.
OK , hopefully that one passes the constraints of copyright
You do know that keeping your wallet in your back pocket is seriously gonna mess with your spine right????
But seriously, that is some awesome editing there Rick  Format & music was refreshing from the same old, same.

But seriously, that is some awesome editing there Rick  Format & music was refreshing from the same old, same. yeah, well, Thanks Simon -  a lot of that is life from G's perspective - combined with we weren't really ready for the filming session. Had the cameras, but we weren't setup up quite yet..... got a bit to learn before we make an entry for TIFF I think My initial choice in music was the cause of the censorship - as it turns out, both tunes.So the tune that the title of the thread was referencing also had to go      Lesson learned re: Youtube - check the details on the video manager screen before releasing....  in all the learning curve challenges of moving to movies, looks like I forgot one of the nicest fish of the weekend   and now its off to work for another week. Gotta pay for all those miles on the boat this weekend.
Great video guys and some nice fish to boot.  G with the go pro and looking pretty stocky there young man.  Thanks for sharing
Nice vid, thanks for taking the time
Great job Rick!!!!,as mentioned,G is getting quite the build !!!
